intro: Tetramolopium consanguineum, commonly known as the redstem ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Tetramolopium consanguineum is often found in dry, open habitats like grasslands and disturbed soils, and it has a sprawling growth habit with hairy stems. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and native plant gardening.
